ygData.subject: RE: About Sit-Ins
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree with Fletcher, he makes a good point. If everyone took what they had found wrong with the game and did some kinda sit-in about it then think no one
ygData.messageBody:
I agree with Fletcher, he makes a good point. If everyone took what they
had found wrong with the game and did some kinda sit-in about it then think
no one would do anything until the game was how they wanted it not how it is
made. This game is constantly going through changes, you knew that when you
bought it, at least I did. If we push Verant to do something instead of
asking them, they will most likely become upset and not do anything
petitions are a good start. I don't know about you I felt that are nerfs are
unfair maybe to balance us out I don't know there thought process. But I
enjoy the game yes it needs work but also so do a lot of things. I say if we
are going to be heard then lets do it civilly not like some barbarian. Well
I get of my bone box and let you think about it. Anyone has anything at All
then email this list and we will go to the source outside the game and lets
try to make a difference.

-----Original Message-----
From: Fletcher, Neal L SGT 224 MI BN
[mailto:FletcherNL@...]
Sent: Friday, December 03, 1999 5:54 AM
To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] About Sit-Ins


From: "Fletcher, Neal L SGT 224 MI BN" <FletcherNL@...>


Ok, so a huge gnome showed up at the first organized sit in. Now EVERYONE
wants to have one. Do you honestly think Smed is going to show up to hear
ANOTHER group of whining players, regardless of whether or not their
complaints were valid? No, he won't. This would encourage people to hold a
sit in for every damn complaint they had (Monsters attacking through
walls=Sit-in! Price for bonechips on vendors too high=Sit in!). The more
you use a tactic like this, the less impact it has. Smed was wrong to even
show up to the first one.

Your best tools for getting something changed are phone calls and mail. Not
Email, that's easy to just delete, good old-fashioned U.S.P.S.. Which would
you pay attention to more, a bunch of messages in your Inbox, or 10 50lb
sacks of mail being dumped on your desk? /Feedback works well to. It takes
effort, not drama. I play a necro, a high level one, and I don't feel that
this warrants a sit in anyway. But it does need to be un-nerfed. All a
massive newbie death fest will do is piss off everyone that's not a necro,
Verant included.

IMNSFHO

This list is basically unmoderated. However abusive language will not be
tolerated
